column4: Can anyone tell me where and how to adjust the main-menu so the items for "shutdown" etc dont appear in it anymore?!
I don't see options for everything there
there is nothing to remove the shutdown button etc is there?
you talking about the panel or the menu?
Well the menu. No matter whether I choose "Main Menu" or "Menu Bar" the Properties Dialog doesnt offer anything to fully customize it,  Chr|s
What do you exactly want to do? Their is nothing in the gnome menu to remove the shut down button
If your talking about the Top Panel to the far right, you just right click and remove
I see Chr|s and thats what bothers me.  Same for the "Menu bar". I cant remove the shortcut to "Places" from it?
I'm not entirely sure, if you make a custom menu yes I think, but why would you want to remove Places?
Simply because I want a custom menu. And I dont want a link to "places" in there
I dunno whats the point of the custom menu if you can hardly configure it besides the subentries
oh crap... never and I say NEVER consider to put a "gnome-terminal" into your .bashrc
can anyone tell me where to place a command for execution upon startup?!
hmm I see.. That is odd, i'm not sure to tell you the truth, their has to be some way, idle in here, maybe someone else could help you.
